name: 阮于軒
objective:
本課程適合修過工程數學及基礎熱流的大學生選修。使用 Ansys 或其他商用軟體，來計算一維穩態，一維暫態，二維穩態，二維暫態，之熱傳導問題，邊界層之偶合性流場問題，燃燒場之數值計算，電子熱傳相關系統。
This course is suitable for the undergraduate students who have taken fundamental courses of engineering mathematics and thermofluid sciences.  By using software of Ansys or other CFD packages to compute the one dimension steady, are dimension unsteady, two dimension steady, two dimension unsteady heat conduction problems, boundary layer compling flow's problems, combustion calculations, electronic heat transfer problems.
schedule:
Week 1: Course Overview 
Week 2: Introduction to CFD/ CFD Implementation and Discussion/Pipe Flow 
Week 3: (Related to USR Project) CFD Implementation and Discussion/ 2D Circular Cylinder Flow
Week 4: (Related to USR Project) CFD Implementation and Discussion/Wind Analysis of Building
Week 5: (Related to USR Project) CFD Implementation and Discussion/ Wind Analysis of Building
Week 6: (Related to USR Project) Off-Campus Visit - Taiwan International Smart Energy Week 
Week 7: (Related to USR Project) Solving CFD with ANSYS FLUENT
Week 8: (Related to USR Project) Solving CFD with ANSYS FLUENT 
Week 9: (Related to USR Project) Mid-term Research Presentation 
Week 10: Introduction to Turbulence Models 
Week 11: CFD Implementation and Discussion/Internal Flow Simulation Practice 
Week 12: CFD Implementation and Discussion/Fan Simulation Analysis 
Week 13: CFD Implementation and Discussion/MRF Rotating Machinery Flow Variation Simulation 
Week 14: CFD Implementation and Discussion/MRF Rotating Machinery Flow Variation Simulation 
Week 15: UDF (User-Defined Function)/Post-processing Configuration Tutorial 
Week 16: CFD Implementation and Discussion/Heat Transfer Simulation Analysis 
Week 17: Oral Presentation (I) 
Week 18: Oral Presentation (II)
scorePolicy:
1.	Participation (10%)
2.	Homework (20%)
3.	Interim Report (30%)
4.	Final Oral Presentation (40%)
materials:
1.	Matsson, J. E. An Introduction to ANSYS Fluent 2021. 2021.
2.	Tu, Jiyuan, Guan Heng Yeoh, and Chaoqun Liu. Computational fluid dynamics: a practical approach. Butterworth-Heinemann, 2018.
3.	Franke, Jorg, et al. "The COST 732 Best Practice Guideline for CFD simulation of flows in the urban environment: a summary." International Journal of Environment and Pollution 44.1-4 (2011): 419-427. 
4.	Tominaga, Yoshihide, et al. "AIJ guidelines for practical applications of CFD to pedestrian wind environment around buildings." Journal of wind engineering and industrial aerodynamics 96.10-11 (2008): 1749-1761.
